results.title: Altered consciousness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Support”.
Examines and defines the altered consciousness state and the problems it causes, in particular, the patient being unable to recognise and thus react to dangers either external e.g. fire, or internal e.g. blocked airway. Looks at Epilepsy, diabetes and head injuries as specific examples. Emergency treatment included . WARNING-The Epilepsy Foundation of Victoria has advised that this program contains outdated information and shows practices no longer followed.

results.title: Altar masterpiece
results.brief_description: During the 15th Century the burghers of Krakow commissioned Wit Stwocz, master wood-carver and sculptor, to create a monumental altar-piece for St. Mary’s church, Krakow, the former capital of Poland. This film describes the altar-piece and its setting in medieval Krakow. It shows how the history of that period, its people, clothes and customs has been woven by Wit Stwocz into the story told in the altar’s carving.

results.title: Alpine vistas: Mt. Hotham
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Charles R. Herschell
results.brief_description: A study of Mount Hotham, one of Victoria’s most popular winter-sport resorts. This film gives a glimpse of life in Victoria during the 1930’s.

results.title: Alpine harvest
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Film Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: A film of the timber industry in the mountainous areas of North-Eastern Victoria. Experts move through the forest, selecting trees to be felled. Then gangs of timber getters move in, felling them, hauling them to the roads, and transporting them to mills.

results.title: Alpha Omega = Alfa Omega
results.brief_description: A satirical cartoon describing the life of a typical modern man from childhood to old age, in six epochs. Between each epoch the individual has to wind himself up enough to see himself through the next phase of his life, but eventually the human “spring” can take no more. No commentary is used, simple music sets the scene.

results.title: Alouette
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren is noted for his many innovative and experimental film animation techniques. He co-animated, with Rene Jodoin, this item for including in a sing-along series, “Lets All Sing Together” (No.1). Single-frame animation of paper cutouts was the technique used.

results.title: Along the track in Central Australia
results.brief_description: Filmed in 1952 by Phillip Crosbie Morrison and the commentary edited from his recorded talks describing a tour with the Royal Australian Ornithologists’ Union, visiting Hermannsburg, Palm Valley, Ayers Rock and Mount Olga. Gives a broad view of the environment as a whole, emphasising the natural beauty and variety of the region and its wild life and showing that although arid it is not all desert.

results.title: Along the power lines
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: The story of electrical power in Victoria from generating stations to consumer. Shows the prompt action taken with mobile radio-controlled teams, when break downs in supply are reported; causes of breakdowns such as lightning. Power generated from power stations at Eildon- Rubicon, the Snowy Mountains, and the Latrobe Valley is directed by engineers at the main control centre near Melbourne to main terminal stations, and on to the consumer. Electricity is distributed at high voltage over long distances, this means danger but skilled linesmen trained in safe techniques patrol existing lines and erect new ones supplying over 90 per cent of Victoria’s industrial power.
